isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - CREATIVE TOOL MODEL CT-400 DIESEL TIMING AND TACHOMETER INSTRUMENT [SE-2783] OR [3005] EARLIER MODEL - OPERATION

svcsubproc.title: "CALIBRATE TO________________"
svcsubproc.para: The numbers shown are the numbers at which this specific instrument is calibrated for accuracy.

svcsubproc.title: "RPM x 10 ADVANCE"
svcsubproc.para: This three digit lighted display shows both engine RPM and degrees of advance. When the "TACH.- ADVANCE" switch is in the "TACH." position, engine RPM is shown in hundreds. Multiply by 10 to determine RPM. When the "TACH.-ADVANCE" switch is in the "ADVANCE" position, the degrees of advance are shown to the nearest tenth of a degree. The lights to the left of the display indicate which mode the instrument is in.

svcsubproc.title: "CAL. ADJ."
svcsubproc.para: This screw is used to set the instrument to the correct calibration. When the "CAL. SWITCH" is moved to the on position and the lighted display does not indicate the correct "CALIBRATE TO_____________ " setting, loosen the locknut and while holding the "CAL. SWITCH" in the on position, rotate the screw with a small screwdriver until the proper "CALIBRATE TO" number appears on the lighted display. Tighten the locknut.

svcsubproc.title: "CAL. SWITCH"
svcsubproc.para: This switch is used to check the accuracy of the instrument at any time during a test. Move the switch and hold. Observe the lighted display. The "CALIBRATE TO__________" number should appear on the lighted display. If the number shown is not correct, adjust as described under "CAL. ADJ." above.

svcsubproc.title: Red Light
svcsubproc.para: This light indicates whether the instrument is on or off.

svcsubproc.title: "ADVANCE"
svcsubproc.para: This knob is used in conjunction with the timing light to determine degrees of advance. The "TACH.- OFF-T. LIGHT" switch must be in the "T. LIGHT" position and the "TACH.-ADVANCE"switch must be in the "ADVANCE" position. With the engine at the desired RPM, rotate the knob counterclockwise to obtain 00.0 on the lighted display. Aiming the timing light at the damper and timing pointer, slowly rotate the knob clockwise until the "TDC" timing mark on the damper and the timing pointer are in alignment. When the marks are in alignment, release the knob. The actual timing will be shown on the lighted display.

note.para: Whenever changing engine speeds, the knob must be rotated back to 00.0 on the display before proceeding.

svcsubproc.title: "TACH.-ADVANCE"
svcsubproc.para: This switch with the red plastic handle has two positions. When it is in the "TACH." position, the lighted display will show engine RPM. When it is in the "ADVANCE" position, the lighted display will show the degrees of advance.

svcsubproc.title: "TACH.-OFF-T. LIGHT"
svcsubproc.para: This switch has three positions. The center, "OFF," position cuts off the power to the instrument and the red light is out. When the switch is moved to the "TACH." position, engine RPM is shown on the lighted display. When the switch is moved to the "T. LIGHT" position, the timing light is activated and degrees of advance are shown on the lighted display.

note.para: Both the "TACH.-ADVANCE" and the "TACH..OFF-T. LIGHT" switches must be in the same modes for the instrument to function properly.
